metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5832 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The customizer in WordPress before 4.5.3 allows remote attackers to bypass intended redirection restrictions via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5832` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 4.5.3+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.5.3+dfsg-1').
